dcterms:creator: R. S. Sutton
A. G. Barto
dcterms:description: A 1-dimensional environment where an agent randomly transitions to one of two neighboring states, with terminal states at each end providing rewards of -1 and 1 respectively. The task is to estimate the value of each state under an equiprobable random behavior policy.
dcterms:title: 19-State Random Walk

dcterms:creator: R. S. Sutton
A. G. Barto
dcterms:description: A tabular navigation task in a gridworld where an agent is affected by upward wind in certain columns, making the next state determined by a stochastic process. The agent receives a constant reward of -1 until reaching the goal.
dcterms:title: Stochastic Windy Gridworld

dcterms:creator: R. S. Sutton
A. G. Barto
dcterms:description: A variant of the mountain car problem where the agent can fall off a cliff if it ventures past the top of the leftmost mountain, receiving a significant penalty. The task involves navigating the car to reach the goal while avoiding the cliff.
dcterms:title: Mountain Cliff
